episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4001_1:
I’m sure a lot of you have been looking forward to
this moment.

On Pasio, sync pairs who set an example for
others to measure up against are given an
honorary title.

We call them Neo Champions! And I hereby
announce that the next competition to become
one begins now!

This time, I, Steven—Champion of the Hoenn
region—will be head judge.
I’ll start by announcing the judging criteria.

As you all know, Pasio is an artificial island.
However...

Some people here have been searching for ways
we can all survive in this world and live together
in harmony.

Through their hard work, Pasio can have beautiful
nature created by the hands of people.

And so, as Champion of Hoenn, a land full
of nature...

I hope to find someone who can lead us in making
a kinder world!

Traveling through this nature on Pasio...
Has it awoken something inside you?

I want you to come at us—the judges—with all
that you’ve learned!

So this time, we’re changing up the judging.
Instead of basing everything on Pokémon battles...
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/6801_1: We gotta live up to Steven’s expectations!

That’s right! And we have Groudon and Kyogre to
lend us their powers!

It’ll be tough, but we’ll be OK as long as we all
work together!

People, Pokémon, and nature... I’m sure we’ll be
fine if we all support each other!
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4002_1:
Are you participating in the Neo Champion
Stadium, May?

Yup! I thought what Steven said was wonderful,
so I decided to join!
Heheh, same!

There can be more than one Neo Champion,
so let’s both aim to win!
Yeah, let’s do our best!
The judging is a little different this time, though.

One of the criteria is how one spends their
time on Pasio, right?
Yup, that’s right.

It’d be pretty straightforward if all we had to do
was win a bunch of Pokémon battles.
Hmm. People, Pokémon, and nature—coexisting...

I know it’s important, but how do we
demonstrate it?

We probably can’t just show our strong bonds
with our Pokémon.

But as Steven said, we’re from Hoenn—a land
rich in nature!
I’m sure we can come up with something!
W-we’re in trouble!
Hm? I wonder what’s going on.
It doesn’t sound good.
G-Groudon and Kyogre are going berserk again!
What?!
Groudon and Kyogre?!
Are Team Aqua and Team Magma at it again?!
No, they called a truce, so that can’t be it.
Let’s go see!
Right!
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4003_1:
We heard Groudon and Kyogre were going
berserk, so we—
Wait, whaaat?! There’s more of them?!
We hurried over too after we heard.

Seems they got lost and wandered over here from
somewhere!

Their power’s unbelievable! Even our Kyogre and
Groudon are gettin’ pushed around!
Sorry to ask, but could you two lend us a hand?
Come on... You gotta be kidding me!
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4004_1: That Groudon and Kyogre...

Yeah, I can’t believe they can undergo Primal
Reversion!
Super-ancient Pokémon and their true forms...

It seems those two possess incredible natural
power deep within.

That power must be stronger than our Groudon
and Kyogre’s.
Yeah. I hate to admit it, but you’re right!

Sheesh! What’s going on? We even had
Mega-Evolved Rayquaza on our side!

It’s true Rayquaza has the power to pacify
super-ancient Pokémon.

But once those two Pokémon are in their primal
states, they possess immeasurable natural energy.

Battling them without collateral damage to Pasio is
near impossible.
I have an idea!

What if we get help from Zinnia and her
Rayquaza?
Unfortunately, she’s declined.
Huh?! Why?
But she battled with us last time!
Her usual reason. We “need some imagination.”
But if she’s letting us handle this on our own...

I don’t think it’s as dangerous as that giant
meteor was.

Then I guess we’ll have to deal with those two
ourselves.
Sounds about right.

But we shouldn’t provoke them, so only those used
to dealing with Groudon and Kyogre should handle
this.
Yeah! We gotta find ’em quick and keep ’em safe!

If they’re found by people who use Pokémon for
evil, we’re in trouble!
Yeah, you’re right!
Um...Maxie! Archie! I have a request!

Could you teach us more about Groudon
and Kyogre?
Hm?

I wanna learn more about them, like their biology,
weaknesses, Primal Reversion, and stuff.

The more we know, the better our odds of
finding a way to tame them!
Me too!
If we both learn, it’ll better our chances!
Bwahahahahahaha!
I dig your grit, you scamps!

Team Aqua can teach you all you need to know
about Kyogre!

It’s important to be open to learning, no matter
the topic.

But we don’t have much time. If we want to be
efficient, we should divvy things up.
Thanks, you two!

All right, I’ll take Groudon and go with Maxie and
Team Magma.

And I’ll take Kyogre and form a study group with
Team Aqua!
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4005_1: In order to stop Groudon and Kyogre...

Brendan started studying Groudon’s biology and
the way it battles—with help from Team Magma!

The effects of Groudon’s natural power are all
recorded in these documents. Specifically...

Be thankful Leader Maxie is teaching you all this!
Listen up and study hard!
Our leader’s talks are always so fun. ♪
(It’s tough keeping up with these lectures...)

(But I think I’m getting closer to understanding
Groudon, May!)
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4006_1:
If you’re gonna face a strong opponent, you gotta
toughen up!

First, we gotta bulk up that flimsy-as-a-Gorebyss
body of yours! So let’s start with strength training!
What in the world are they doing?
Sorry you had to deal with those fools.
I’m sure you didn’t come here for strength training.

Ahaha... I guess I just went with it ’cause they
were so enthusiastic.
It helped clear your mind, though, right?
Oh, yeah... I guess it did.
I’ve a lot of documents on Kyogre.

(I’m starting to understand what kind of Pokémon
Kyogre is, Brendan!)
(And I’ve even built some muscle, too!)
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4007_1: By the looks of you two...
I’d say you’ve come up with something!

Groudon and Kyogre’s powers are strengthened
by nature!

So first, we should lure them somewhere they can’t
use their powers well!

Then you and Mega Rayquaza can step in
and help!

I see... If we do that, we might be able to limit
their strength.
All right! Just you wait, Groudon and Kyogre!
Let’s work as a team and give it our all!
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4008_1:
With help from Team Magma, Team Aqua,
and Rayquaza, we’ve led them here,
somewhere grassy.

Where there’s no magma or ocean to pull
power from.
All’s going to plan so far.
Let the battle begin! Let’s do this!
Rayquaza! You and I will support them!

Looks like they can’t use their powers as well
here—just as we thought!

But I don’t know how much longer we can keep
this up.
Sorry, Pasio! Bear with us just a bit longer!
I’ll leave the rest to you, Latios!

People, Pokémon, and nature...
By borrowing all the powers of this world...
We’re so close! Let’s go, May!

Now we can all rest easy...Groudon and Kyogre...
Even all of Pasio!

Not only did you stop their rampage, but you also
successfully caught them.
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4009_1: After observing Pasio these past few days...

I’ve found some sync pairs I’d like to nominate as
Neo Champions for this round.
I’d love to hear your thoughts.
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4010_1: I’d like you all to congratulate...

As they tried to stop a Groudon and Kyogre that
appeared on Pasio from going out of control...

they demonstrated teamwork by relying on
Team Aqua and Team Magma!

Moreover, they successfully caught Groudon and
Kyogre by using the power of nature and working
together with Pokémon!

People, Pokémon, and nature... They showed us a
world where all can work together and support
each other.

That’s exactly what I hoped to see in a Neo
Champion. They’re truly amazing!

From now on, I hope you’ll continue to be an
example for us all—and a model of coexistence
with your Groudon and Kyogre!
episode_event_ch0019_90_ch0126_90/4011_1:
There’re too many things happening to us
these days.
it was fun, despite all the challenges!

Even all that strength training I did with
Team Aqua is now a fond memory!
Strength training?! What do you mean?
Hehe! I look a little stronger now, don’t I?

Come to think of it, we still haven’t put our
research to the test.
Groudon or Kyogre—which one is stronger?
